com.company

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    A player object represents the person playing the game. The player can move around
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Jeremy Wolff

      • findItem

        public Item findItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        Finds a specific item in the player's inventory.
        Parameters:
        itemName - item to find.
        Returns:
        Item, if found. If not found, then null.

      • tryToTakeItem

        public void tryToTakeItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        The player is attempting to take an item in the room. This method iterates through all items in the room to check if any of their names matches that of the name of the item the player tried to pick up. If the item is found, it is added to the player inventory and removed from the room. If the item is not found, a message is displayed saying that The item was not found.
        Parameters:
        itemName - the name of the item the player is trying to take.

      • tryToUseItem

        public void tryToUseItem(java.lang.String itemName)
        If the item actually exists, then we attempt to activate the item event via the item's useItem function.
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the item that the player tried to use.

      • outputInventory

        public void outputInventory()
        Loop through each item in the player's inventory and add the item name to a temporary variable, inventoryText. Then print out the inventoryText.

      • tryToMove

        public boolean tryToMove(java.lang.String direction)
        Try to move the player in the direction that the player has indicated.
        Parameters:
        direction - A reference to the direction that the user is moving
        Returns:
        true if the move was successful.
